column6: someone who rents out something for example a house

definition: iemand naar een andere plaats of persoon sturen
column6: sending someone to another place or person

column6: a school that teaches from a specific religion or belief for example an Islamic school or a Montessori school

definition: een ziekte die nooit helemaal verdwijnt = langdurige ziekte
column6: an illness that never completely disappears = long-term illness

column6: when someone continues with education at another level; students can for example progress from mbo to hbo

definition: het geloven in een god
column6: believing in a god

column6: a limitation that prevents you from using part of your body or mind properly

column6: abbreviation for: higher general secondary education

column6: children from 5 years to 16 years must attend school compulsorily

column6: the school where children go when they finish primary school

column6: the grade; in secondary education you have different learning levels

column6: a school where faith plays no role

definition: iets wat je moet doen
column6: something you must do

column6: a form of secondary education intended for students who are strong in practical subjects

column6: education for students who cannot follow regular education for example because they need a lot of extra attention

column6: everything that people make and use to solve problems

column6: an institution for science and education in science

column6: education after secondary school such as mbo hbo or university

definition: onderwijs dat volgt na het basisonderwijs
column6: education that follows after primary education

column6: abbreviation for: preparatory scientific education this is the highest track in secondary school that prepares for university

column6: the legal obligation for children to go to school; in the Netherlands children between 5 and 16 years are subject to compulsory education

column6: a volunteer who helps children in primary school with reading usually the father or mother of a student

column6: a meeting at school where the school invites all parents to come

column6: involvement of parents in the upbringing and education of their child both at home and at school

column6: an overview of a student's achievements at school

column6: something you do voluntarily you do because you want to yourself

column6: extra study allowance you get if your parents' income is below a certain limit

column6: allowance you get from the government when you study

column6: the agency that ensures taxes are paid

column6: abbreviation for: education executive agency arranges for example financing for students

column6: an amount that parents receive from the government every three months to pay costs associated with raising a child

column6: an extra allowance for parents with children up to 18 years who are below a certain income limit

column6: when you have obtained a diploma your loan changes into a gift

definition: in de middagpauze niet naar huis gaan maar op school blijven om te lunchen

column6: money you get from the government to pay for your studies

column6: abbreviation for: social insurance bank agency that implements social insurance such as AOW and child benefit

column6: a voluntary contribution that parents of school-going children pay for certain costs that a school incurs

column6: care for children before and after lessons at primary school

column6: amount that parents receive monthly from the government to pay for childcare costs

column6: care for children from 2 to 4 years old intended as preparation for primary school = preschool

column6: record in a register so that it is official

column6: a list of people waiting for for example a place in childcare

column6: the illness where someone is extremely preoccupied with eating and/or their weight

column6: raising a child to ensure that it shows good behavior
